modelCorrections.beforeModification: <html class="history svg video supports boxshadow csstransforms3d csstransitions backgroundcliptext webkit chrome win js sticky-header-enabled sticky-header-active">
modelCorrections.afterModification: <html lang="en" class="history svg video supports boxshadow csstransforms3d csstransitions backgroundcliptext webkit chrome win js sticky-header-enabled sticky-header-active">
modelCorrections.rawOutput:
Here's the corrected HTML based on the WCAG 2.1 violation description and the provided example:

*Extracted text from website*: "CCTV Camera"
- Incorrect HTML: <html class="history svg video supports boxshadow csstransforms3d csstransitions backgroundcliptext webkit chrome win js sticky-header-enabled sticky-header-active">
- Corrected HTML: <html lang="en" class="history svg video supports boxshadow csstransforms3d csstransitions backgroundcliptext webkit chrome win js sticky-header-enabled sticky-header-active">

The correction adds the lang attribute with the value "en" to the <html> element, indicating that the language of the document is English. This helps assistive technologies and search engines understand the language of the content.
